ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take it. Learn about int. econ. but from an intuition point of view (which is what is helpful. And the experience of being with Professor Cavallo and the guest he brings is incredible.
I would, because the course was an interesting run-through of important financial crises and a great way of understanding basic international economics theory and its relevance to policymaking.
I would recommend this class without reservation for other students.
I would recommend it as a small class that covers the macroeconomics of financial crisis with a strong emphasis on historical analysis.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am interested in international political economy, and the course was also very useful in seeing how domestic and international economic structures respond to or create political outcomes. I feel it gave me a much better grounding in recent global economic history.

I am much more able to understand now the international flows which contribute to stability or instability in different currency regimes. Also, I now understand the role of the central bank and what takes place while upholding a currency exchange rate. Also, the pros and cons of inflation and deflations. These are critically important to my studies in developing markets.
